symbols.name: sap.ndc
symbols.description: SAPUI5 library with controls with native device capabilities.

nodes.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner
nodes.description:
TODO: description

As BarcodeScanner is a static class, a jQuery.sap.require("sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner"); statement must be explicitly executed before the class can be used. Example: * 

jQuery.sap.require("sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner");
sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner.scan(
    function (oResult) { / * process scan result * / },
    function (oError) { / * handle scan error * / },
    function (oResult) { / * handle input dialog change * / }
);

nodes.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton
nodes.description: A button control (displaying a bar code icon) to start the bar code scanning process.

symbols.title: namespace sap.ndc

symbols.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner
symbols.description:
TODO: description

As BarcodeScanner is a static class, a jQuery.sap.require("sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner"); statement must be explicitly executed before the class can be used. Example: * 

jQuery.sap.require("sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner");
sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner.scan(
    function (oResult) { / * process scan result * / },
    function (oError) { / * handle scan error * / },
    function (oResult) { / * handle input dialog change * / }
);

methods.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner.closeScanDialog
methods.description: Closes the bar code input dialog. It can be used to close the dialog before the user presses the OK or the Cancel button (e.g. in the fnLiveUpdate callback function of the sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner.scan method.)

methods.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner.getStatusModel
methods.description: Returns the status model of the BarcodeScanner. It is a JSON model which contains a single boolean property 'available' indicating whether or not the bar code scanner feature is available. It can be used to bind to the visible property of UI controls which have to be hidden in case the feature is unavailable.

methods.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner.scan

parameters.name: fnSuccess
parameters.description: Function to be called when the scanning is done or cancelled

parameters.name: fnFail
parameters.description: Function to be called when the scanning is failed

parameters.name: fnLiveUpdate
parameters.description: Function to be called when value of the dialog's input is changed

methods.description:
Starts the bar code scanning process either showing the live input from the camera or displaying a dialog to enter the value directly if the bar code scanning feature is not available.

sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner.scan(fnSuccess, fnFail, fnLiveUpdate)

The bar code scanning is done asynchronously. When it is triggered, this function returns without waiting for the scanning process to finish. The applications have to provide callback functions to react to the events of a successful scanning, an error during scanning, and the live input on the dialog.

fnSuccess is passed an object with text, format and cancelled properties. Text is the text representation of the bar code data, format is the type of the bar code detected, and cancelled is whether or not the user cancelled the scan. fnError is given the error, fnLiveUpdate is passed the new value entered in the dialog's input field. An example:

sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner.scan(
   function (mResult) {
      alert("We got a bar code\n" +
            "Result: " + mResult.text + "\n" +
            "Format: " + mResult.format + "\n" +
            "Cancelled: " + mResult.cancelled);
   },
   function (Error) {
      alert("Scanning failed: " + Error);
   },
   function (mParams) {
      alert("Value entered: " + mParams.newValue);
   }
);

symbols.title: namespace sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner

symbols.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton
symbols.description: A button control (displaying a bar code icon) to start the bar code scanning process. If the native scanning feature is not available, the button is either hidden or it provides a fallback by opening a dialog with an input field where the bar code can be entered manually.

properties.name: provideFallback
properties.description: If set to true, the button remains visible if the scanner is not available and triggers a dialog to enter bar code.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: The invisible bar code scanner button is not rendered regardless of the availability of the native scan feature.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the scanner button.

aggregations.name: _btn
aggregations.description: Internal aggregation to hold the inner Button.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new BarcodeScannerButton.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: inputLiveUpdate

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: The new value of the input field.

events.description: Event is fired when the text in the dialog's input field is changed.

events.name: scanFail
events.description: Event is fired when the native scanning process is failed.

events.name: scanSuccess

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The the text representation of the bar code data.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The type of the bar code detected.

parameters.name: cancelled
parameters.description: Indicates whether or not the user cancelled the scan.

events.description: Event is fired when the scanning is finished or cancelled

methods.name: attachInputLiveUpdate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the inputLiveUpdate event of this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton itself.

Event is fired when the text in the dialog's input field is changed.

methods.name: attachScanFail

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the scanFail event of this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton itself.

Event is fired when the native scanning process is failed.

methods.name: attachScanSuccess

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the scanSuccess event of this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton itself.

Event is fired when the scanning is finished or cancelled

methods.name: detachInputLiveUpdate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the inputLiveUpdate event of this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the scanSuccess event of this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton.extend

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Control.extend.

parameters.name: cancelled

methods.description: Fires event scanSuccess to attached listeners.

methods.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton.getMetadata
methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton.

methods.name: getProvideFallback
methods.description:
Gets current value of property provideFallback.

If set to true, the button remains visible if the scanner is not available and triggers a dialog to enter bar code.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getVisible
methods.description:
Gets current value of property visible.

The invisible bar code scanner button is not rendered regardless of the availability of the native scan feature.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getWidth
methods.description:
Gets current value of property width.

Defines the width of the scanner button.

methods.name: setProvideFallback

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bProvideFallback
parameters.description: New value for property provideFallback

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property provideFallback.

If set to true, the button remains visible if the scanner is not available and triggers a dialog to enter bar code.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setVisible

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bVisible
parameters.description: New value for property visible

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property visible.

The invisible bar code scanner button is not rendered regardless of the availability of the native scan feature.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setWidth

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sWidth
parameters.description: New value for property width

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property width.

Defines the width of the scanner button.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.
